data.title: Theatre and More
data.text: The Center for the Arts is a hidden gem in Murfreesboro.  Although we have been to a number of delightful plays put on by local talent, there is a nice art gallery with enjoyable  art work by local artists as well.  It always amazes me to see the hidden talent of local people that you know brought forth once they take part in one of these great plays.  Each season features a wide range of plays, drama, comedy and even suspense, allow everyone to find at least one production every season that appeals to them. We have yet to be disappointed in any show we've attended.  Season tickets are available and it's handicap accessible.

data.title: Playss
data.text: I really enjoy the Center for the Arts.  The plays are ran by local people.  I have never been disapointed!

Every play I've attended here is well done. The theatre has a cozy feel, the tickets sales are handled well.  The musicals are fantastic, amazing costumes ,.  Such talent showcased well,  Great place for date night or just to be entertained!

data.title: Great place for a music recital!
data.text: We recently visited to attend an event and were comfortable for the 4 hour music recital. The bathrooms and other facilitates were close by as well as the parking convenient.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: I've seen a few plays here and attended some special functions.  The plays are always great and the special functions exemplary.

data.title: Have A Great Time At Murfreesboro Center for the Arts
data.text: The Center for the Arts is an extremely good place to see local actors and singers perform.  I really enjoy!

data.title: Community Theater
data.text: I love this little gem! It's a small community theater with an attached art gallery featuring local artists in what use to be the old library in downtown Murfreesboro. The plays here are fantastic. I recently just went to West Side Story, it was awesome! You are sure to have a pleasant evening in this community theater where there are no bad seats!!!

data.title: Definitely worth the cost of admission!
data.text: I have enjoyed a couple of wonderful seasons of plays and musicals at the Center for the Arts.  Even the children's productions are very enjoyable.

data.title: Great date night
data.text: Enjoy a production put on at the theatre! They have had some wonderfully great shows! Recently saw "Music Man" which was awesome!

data.title: Good entertainment
data.text: Visited Nashville this week and made the trip out to Murfreesboro to take in the sights and watch Bonnie and Clyde. This is a small theater, I wouldn't think more than a hundred seats. I reserved my tickets online and they were waiting as promised. The staff were all friendly and the actors were all talented singers. Not a bad show, especially for the price.

data.title: Powerful performances in this place
data.text:
My husband and attended a Raisin in the Sun not too long ago and it was a very powerful and professional performance by locals.  The theatre is quaint with cushioned seats. Not a bad seat in the house. 

The Center for the Arts upcoming events include Bonnie and Clyde, West Side Story, Harvey, The Addams Family and White Christmas. 

Great place to take the family. Cost is reasonable for entry and concessions.

data.title: Always a fun place to go
data.text: I've been here many times for different plays.  Personal taste is always a factor when trying to review a place like this, but I would say that, with a rare exception, I have always thoroughly enjoyed myself.  You can't beat the value, either.  Great price for an evening of entertainment.
